title: Yichen Ji
text: If you would like to download my bio and CV, please click the CV bottom above.

title: Yichen Ji
text:
Academic appointments

Assistant Professor, Information & Statistical Sciences, University of Toronto
Jul 2020 - current

Parental leave: From June to August 2021 I was on parental leave.
COVID-19: From March to December 2020 I shared full-time childcare duties (0.5 FTE on average). From January 2021 to May 2021, and again from September to December 2021, I shared part-time childcare duties, (0.25 FTE on average).

Assistant Director, Canadian Statistical Sciences Institute (CANSSI) Ontario
Sep 2021 - current

CANSSI Ontario has an annual operating budget of around $1 million.

I support the director and three full-time staff to promote research in data science and statistics by providing funding and hosting events.


“CV in PDF”

title: Yichen Ji
text:
Education

Honours Bachelor of Science, University of Toronto(St.George Campus)
Jul 2022 - current

300 level courses: ECO358 Financial Economics I, ECO349 Financial Market, ECO364 International Trade.

Honours Bachelor of Arts, Queen’s University
Sep 2020 - Jun 2022

2021 Dean’s List

title: Yichen Ji
text:
Skills

Quantitative Analysis

Proficiency in statistical analysis and modeling using R and Python
Experience with econometric modeling and forecasting
Understanding of advanced mathematical concepts and applications in economic theory
Data visualization skills, including the use of software like Tableau or Python libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn



Research Skills

Strong background in qualitative and quantitative research methodologies
Competence in using databases such as Bloomberg, Thomson Reuters Eikon, and CRSP for data extraction and analysis
Familiarity with academic research process, literature review, and hypothesis testing



Economic Knowledge

Solid understanding of microeconomic and macroeconomic principles
Insight into economic policy implications and market trends
Knowledge of international trade frameworks and financial systems



Technical Proficiency

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, including pivot tables, vlookups, and macros
Working knowledge of SQL for database querying and management
Basic understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications in economic data



Communication Skills

Ability to present complex economic concepts in an understandable manner
Proficient in report writing and presenting findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
Effective collaboration within team environments and with cross-functional groups



Problem-Solving

Analytical thinking with the ability to interpret data to make informed decisions
Creative problem-solving skills in both academic and practical settings
Strong logical reasoning abilities



Organization & Project Management

Time management skills with a track record of meeting deadlines
Experience in coordinating and leading project teams
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment

title: Yichen Ji
text:
I am an undergraduate student at University of Toronto (St.George Campus), majoring in Economics with minors in Statistics and Mathematics, expanding my academic horizons within the realms of data and analysis. On campus, I am known as a pragmatist with an innovative spirit. My fascination with economics stems from a deep interest in the theories that govern our markets and a passion for applying these theories to real-world challenges. My choice of minors reflects my deep dive into the realm of data analytics, as I firmly believe in the indispensable role of precise analysis in today’s decision-making and policy formulation.
By studying the fundamentals of both micro and macroeconomics, I have developed critical thinking and analytical capabilities, while my training in statistics and mathematics has deepened my quantitative research skills. I regularly engage in academic competitions and research projects outside of my coursework, which has not only bolstered my practical abilities but also enabled me to collaborate with peers from diverse backgrounds.
Beyond the confines of the classroom, I actively participate in student organizations and volunteer initiatives, believing that these experiences shape a well-rounded character and foster leadership qualities. Looking ahead, I aspire to apply my knowledge and enthusiasm in the field of economic policy-making or financial analysis, contributing to the creation of a more equitable and prosperous society.
In my downtime, I enjoy reading history books, drawing lessons from past economic systems and societal shifts. I am also passionate about traveling, as it allows me to directly experience and understand the economic frameworks of different cultures.
If you are interested in my academic background or any collaborative opportunities, please feel free to reach out.
